annotation.message: An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.

a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SHepatitisB4DoseLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.Hepatitis B.4-dose schedule) * Schedule Table: 4-dose schedule (birth dose + 3 primary series doses), on-time start */ library IMMZD18SHepatitisB4DoseLogic

def.name: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Type of dose"= "Primary series") = 1

a:s.a:s: "One hepatitis B primary series dose was administered"

expression.name: One hepatitis B primary series dose was administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of hepatitis B dose 1

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: Child's birth

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date of birth"

a:s.a:s: "First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered"

operand.name: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date of birth" + Member States defined lower limit

a:s.a:s: // Syntax is strange because using a parameter else null

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: The following option is considered appropriate: 4 doses, where a monovalent birth dose is followed by 3 (monovalent or combined vaccine) doses, usually given with other routine infant vaccines; the additional dose does not cause any harm. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:s.a:s: 'The following option is considered appropriate: 4 doses, where a monovalent birth dose is followed by 3 (monovalent or combined vaccine) doses, usually given with other routine infant vaccines; the additional dose does not cause any harm. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.'

operand.value: The following option is considered appropriate: 4 doses, where a monovalent birth dose is followed by 3 (monovalent or combined vaccine) doses, usually given with other routine infant vaccines; the additional dose does not cause any harm. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

def.name: Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Type of dose"= "Primary series") = 2

a:s.a:s: "Two hepatitis B primary series doses were administered"

expression.name: Two hepatitis B primary series doses were administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of hepatitis B dose 2

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Type of dose"= "Primary series") = 1

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered"
"Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered"

operand.name: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered
Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines") + 4 weeks

operand.name: Date of Latest Hepatitis B Dose

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: The following option is considered appropriate: 4 doses, where a monovalent birth dose is followed by 3 (monovalent or combined vaccine) doses, usually given with other routine infant vaccines; the additional dose does not cause any harm. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:s.a:s: 'The following option is considered appropriate: 4 doses, where a monovalent birth dose is followed by 3 (monovalent or combined vaccine) doses, usually given with other routine infant vaccines; the additional dose does not cause any harm. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.'

The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

def.name: Third hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Third hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Completed the primary vaccination series" = TRUE (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "Three hepatitis B primary series doses were administered"
